intro: Glossorhyncha acutiflora, commonly known as the sharp-flowered glossorhyncha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, acute leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
